element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: The algorithm calculates incoming solar radiation for a given period over a given area.

element.name: SOLARCONST
element.text: The value of the solar constant (i.e the amount of incoming solar electromagnetic radiation per unit area, measured on the outer surface of Earth's atmosphere in a plane perpendicular to the rays)

element.name: METHOD
element.text: the method to use. * Global atmospheric transmittance * Calculate transmittance from components

element.name: LATITUDE
element.text: The latitude, needed to calculare Sun's position

element.name: HOURSTEP
element.text: Each day is divided in periods based on a given interval. The shorter the interval, the longer it will take to execute the algorithm and the more precise the result will be.

element.name: DAILYSTEP
element.text: The total period of the calculation is divided in periods based on a given interval. The shorter the interval the longer it will take to execute the algorithm and the more precise the result will be.

element.name: TIME
element.text: Total time during which a given cell receives solar radiation along the selected time span.

element.name: RADIATION
element.text: Total energy received in the cell, in Kw/hour·m2
